intro: Zygophyllum lahovarii, commonly known as the desert buckthorn, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It is a shrub or small tree with distinctive yellowish or reddish flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has small, leathery leaves that help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Zygophyllum lahovarii is adapted to survive in extreme conditions, making it an important component of desert ecosystems.
